article: The sun didn't come out. The 15 - year - old girl Razeena said goodbye to her mother and left for school. She was thinking about the coming Christmas and _ the holiday lights at the nearby senior citizens' apartment _ she noticed some smoke through the door. The building is on fire ! She looked around wildly, _ not a soul was in _ . Razeena _ ."Fire ! " she yelled, running into the hallway and striking on every door she saw, "Everybody get _ !" The building had two floors, she pulled herself _ ,where the thick _ was hanging just a few feet _ the floor. She could see pairs of slippered feet----but no one was moving. She _ they couldn't see where to go ! "Down here ! and follow me !" she yelled. _ ) down the stairs. So she pounded up and down the stairs, weaving through the smoke and heat to _ more people. " Take my arm," she told the extremely _ residents. Her eyes burned and flames were hissing louder. Finally, she led the last person out. _ stood on the side walk, dazed and crying. "Thank you so much," they told her over and over, " Without you, we never would have made it ." When Razeena walked home, shaking and _ with dirt, mother cried, " What happened?!" " There was a fire...so many people ... I think I _ them all." She burst into tears, " I _ my uniform. I thought you might be mad! " Mother _ her head, tears in her eyes, "Oh honey, I'm so _ of you," she whispered.
